It would be better to take the tsuba off the mount so the whole thing can be
seen. It is not Kyo from what I can see of it.

 

Gordon

 

-----Original Message-----
From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com [mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of Elliott
Sent: Wednesday, May 23, 2007 12:13 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Tsuba ID

 

I am back! With another question. I own a sword that has a mei of Soshu 
Ju Hiromasa. It is papered by NBTHK as Hozon attributing this mei as 
correct. I have researched the Zuikan, Jiten and Fujishiro and believe 
it is a correct signature and probably the fifth Hiromasa.

The question is, who made the Tsuba? Is it Kyo-sukashi or Akasaka? Or 
is it something else? Please see my photo album for the pictures I have 
of it. All the pic's show it mounted. 

Thank you as always,

Elliott
